poem:
Title: Veins of Clay

In the promise of dawn, the cries of the dispossessed,
Etching sorrow in the sinews of Gaza. A sigh,
Part prayer, part mourning, drapes over Rafah's ruins.
While the White House, its walls of alabaster silence,
Seek answers where scars speak more than words.
In the swinging cathedral's censer, sorrow burns;
Can man shape mercy with hands still soiled by cruelty?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
